alice.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

bob.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Find the earliest 30-minute time slot on Tuesday 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 when all three are available, with a tie-breaker that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on 2025-10-21
Find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available
If multiple slots work, choose the one that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule
All times are local and expressed in 24-hour format

analyze_availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide a standardized list of your available time intervals on the meeting date using start and end times in 24-hour format. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only a concise structured representation of your availability.
analyze_availability.prompt: Your name is alice. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->alice->private_information} This is your task: {agents->alice->goal} Extract and emit your availability in a clear structured form that can be consumed by an orchestrator.

analyze_availability.system_prompt: You are Bob. Provide a standardized list of your available time intervals on the meeting date using start and end times in 24-hour format. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only a concise structured representation of your availability.
analyze_availability.prompt: Your name is bob. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->bob->private_information} This is your task: {agents->bob->goal} Extract and emit your availability in a clear structured form that can be consumed by an orchestrator.

analyze_availability.system_prompt: You are Carol. Provide a standardized list of your available time intervals on the meeting date using start and end times in 24-hour format. Do not emit PDDL. Provide only a concise structured representation of your availability.
analyze_availability.prompt: Your name is carol. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->carol->private_information} This is your task: {agents->carol->goal} Extract and emit your availability in a clear structured form that can be consumed by an orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in creating PDDL models for scheduling and constraint optimization for the FastDownwards solver. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the search for the earliest meeting start time of duration equal to the meeting_duration_minutes on the meeting_date such that all participants are available. Encode a tie-breaker preference that minimizes interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep participant actions and availability representations distinct and explicit.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The global goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Use the following participant availabilities as provided by their analysis: {alice_availability} {bob_availability} {carol_availability} Use the environment initialization values: meeting_date {environment->init->meeting_date} meeting_duration_minutes {environment->init->meeting_duration_minutes} time_resolution_minutes {environment->init->time_resolution_minutes} Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute slot when all participants are available and applies the tie-breaker minimizing interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the domain and problem with <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags respectively.
